00050 enum LineType {
00051   LT_START = 'S',     // First line of a paragraph.
00052   LT_BODY = 'C',      // Continuation line of a paragraph.
00053   LT_UNKNOWN = 'U',   // No clues.
00054   LT_MULTIPLE = 'M',  // Matches for both LT_START and LT_BODY.
00055 };
00056 
00057 // The first paragraph in a page of body text is often un-indented.
00058 // This is a typographic convention which is common to indicate either that:
00059 // (1) The paragraph is the continuation of a previous paragraph, or
00060 // (2) The paragraph is the first paragraph in a chapter.
00061 //
00062 // I refer to such paragraphs as "crown"s, and the output of the paragraph
00063 // detection algorithm attempts to give them the same paragraph model as
00064 // the rest of the body text.
00065 //
00066 // Nonetheless, while building hypotheses, it is useful to mark the lines
00067 // of crown paragraphs temporarily as crowns, either aligned left or right.
00068 extern const ParagraphModel *kCrownLeft;
00069 extern const ParagraphModel *kCrownRight;
00070 
00071 inline bool StrongModel(const ParagraphModel *model) {
00072   return model != NULL && model != kCrownLeft && model != kCrownRight;
00073 }
00074 
00075 struct LineHypothesis {
00076   LineHypothesis() : ty(LT_UNKNOWN), model(NULL) {}
00077   LineHypothesis(LineType line_type, const ParagraphModel *m)
00078       : ty(line_type), model(m) {}
00079   LineHypothesis(const LineHypothesis &other)
00080       : ty(other.ty), model(other.model) {}
00081 
00082   bool operator==(const LineHypothesis &other) const {
00083     return ty == other.ty && model == other.model;
00084   }
00085 
00086   LineType ty;
00087   const ParagraphModel *model;
00088 };
00089

00092 typedef GenericVectorEqEq<const ParagraphModel *> SetOfModels;
00093 
00094 // Row Scratch Registers are data generated by the paragraph detection
00095 // algorithm based on a RowInfo input.
00096 class RowScratchRegisters {
00097  public:
00098   // We presume row will outlive us.
00099   void Init(const RowInfo &row);
00100 
00101   LineType GetLineType() const;
00102 
00103   LineType GetLineType(const ParagraphModel *model) const;
00104 
00105   // Mark this as a start line type, sans model.  This is useful for the
00106   // initial marking of probable body lines or paragraph start lines.
00107   void SetStartLine();
00108 
00109   // Mark this as a body line type, sans model.  This is useful for the
00110   // initial marking of probably body lines or paragraph start lines.
00111   void SetBodyLine();
00112 
00113   // Record that this row fits as a paragraph start line in the given model,
00114   void AddStartLine(const ParagraphModel *model);
00115   // Record that this row fits as a paragraph body line in the given model,
00116   void AddBodyLine(const ParagraphModel *model);
00117 
00118   // Clear all hypotheses about this line.
00119   void SetUnknown() { hypotheses_.truncate(0); }
00120 
00121   // Append all hypotheses of strong models that match this row as a start.
00122   void StartHypotheses(SetOfModels *models) const;
00123 
00124   // Append all hypotheses of strong models matching this row.
00125   void StrongHypotheses(SetOfModels *models) const;
00126 
00127   // Append all hypotheses for this row.
00128   void NonNullHypotheses(SetOfModels *models) const;
00129 
00130   // Discard any hypotheses whose model is not in the given list.
00131   void DiscardNonMatchingHypotheses(const SetOfModels &models);
00132 
00133   // If we have only one hypothesis and that is that this line is a paragraph
00134   // start line of a certain model, return that model.  Else return NULL.
00135   const ParagraphModel *UniqueStartHypothesis() const;
00136 
00137   // If we have only one hypothesis and that is that this line is a paragraph
00138   // body line of a certain model, return that model.  Else return NULL.
00139   const ParagraphModel *UniqueBodyHypothesis() const;
00140 
00141   // Return the indentation for the side opposite of the aligned side.
00142   int OffsideIndent(tesseract::ParagraphJustification just) const {
00143     switch (just) {
00144       case tesseract::JUSTIFICATION_RIGHT: return lindent_;
00145       case tesseract::JUSTIFICATION_LEFT: return rindent_;
00146       default: return lindent_ > rindent_ ? lindent_ : rindent_;
00147     }
00148   }
00149 
00150   // Return the indentation for the side the text is aligned to.
00151   int AlignsideIndent(tesseract::ParagraphJustification just) const {
00152     switch (just) {
00153       case tesseract::JUSTIFICATION_RIGHT: return rindent_;
00154       case tesseract::JUSTIFICATION_LEFT: return lindent_;
00155       default: return lindent_ > rindent_ ? lindent_ : rindent_;
00156     }
00157   }
00158 
00159   // Append header fields to a vector of row headings.
00160   static void AppendDebugHeaderFields(GenericVector<STRING> *header);
00161 
00162   // Append data for this row to a vector of debug strings.
00163   void AppendDebugInfo(const ParagraphTheory &theory,
00164                        GenericVector<STRING> *dbg) const;
00165 
00166   const RowInfo *ri_;
00167 
00168   // These four constants form a horizontal box model for the white space
00169   // on the edges of each line.  At each point in the algorithm, the following
00170   // shall hold:
00171   //   ri_->pix_ldistance = lmargin_ + lindent_
00172   //   ri_->pix_rdistance = rindent_ + rmargin_
00173   int lmargin_;
00174   int lindent_;
00175   int rindent_;
00176   int rmargin_;
00177 
00178  private:
00179   // Hypotheses of either LT_START or LT_BODY
00180   GenericVectorEqEq<LineHypothesis> hypotheses_;
00181 };
00182 
00183 // A collection of convenience functions for wrapping the set of
00184 // Paragraph Models we believe correctly model the paragraphs in the image.
00185 class ParagraphTheory {
00186  public:
00187   // We presume models will outlive us, and that models will take ownership
00188   // of any ParagraphModel *'s we add.
00189   explicit ParagraphTheory(GenericVector<ParagraphModel *> *models)
00190       : models_(models) {}
00191   GenericVector<ParagraphModel *> &models() { return *models_; }
00192   const GenericVector<ParagraphModel *> &models() const { return *models_; }
00193 
00194   // Return an existing model if one that is Comparable() can be found.
00195   // Else, allocate a new copy of model to save and return a pointer to it.
00196   const ParagraphModel *AddModel(const ParagraphModel &model);
00197 
00198   // Discard any models we've made that are not in the list of used models.
00199   void DiscardUnusedModels(const SetOfModels &used_models);
00200 
00201   // Return the set of all non-centered models.
00202   void NonCenteredModels(SetOfModels *models);
00203 
00204   // If any of the non-centered paragraph models we know about fit
00205   // rows[start, end), return it.  Else NULL.
00206   const ParagraphModel *Fits(const GenericVector<RowScratchRegisters> *rows,
00207                              int start, int end) const;
00208 
00209   int IndexOf(const ParagraphModel *model) const;
00210 
00211  private:
00212   GenericVector<ParagraphModel *> *models_;
00213   GenericVectorEqEq<ParagraphModel *> models_we_added_;
00214 };

00216 bool ValidFirstLine(const GenericVector<RowScratchRegisters> *rows,
00217                     int row, const ParagraphModel *model);
00218 bool ValidBodyLine(const GenericVector<RowScratchRegisters> *rows,
00219                    int row, const ParagraphModel *model);
00220 bool CrownCompatible(const GenericVector<RowScratchRegisters> *rows,
00221                      int a, int b, const ParagraphModel *model);

00223 // A class for smearing Paragraph Model hypotheses to surrounding rows.
00224 // The idea here is that StrongEvidenceClassify first marks only exceedingly
00225 // obvious start and body rows and constructs models of them.  Thereafter,
00226 // we may have left over unmarked lines (mostly end-of-paragraph lines) which
00227 // were too short to have much confidence about, but which fit the models we've
00228 // constructed perfectly and which we ought to mark.  This class is used to
00229 // "smear" our models over the text.
00230 class ParagraphModelSmearer {
00231  public:
00232   ParagraphModelSmearer(GenericVector<RowScratchRegisters> *rows,
00233                         int row_start, int row_end,
00234                         ParagraphTheory *theory);
00235 
00236   // Smear forward paragraph models from existing row markings to subsequent
00237   // text lines if they fit, and mark any thereafter still unmodeled rows
00238   // with any model in the theory that fits them.
00239   void Smear();
00240 
00241  private:
00242   // Record in open_models_ for rows [start_row, end_row) the list of models
00243   // currently open at each row.
00244   // A model is still open in a row if some previous row has said model as a
00245   // start hypothesis, and all rows since (including this row) would fit as
00246   // either a body or start line in that model.
00247   void CalculateOpenModels(int row_start, int row_end);
00248 
00249   SetOfModels &OpenModels(int row) {
00250     return open_models_[row - row_start_ + 1];
00251   }
00252 
00253   ParagraphTheory *theory_;
00254   GenericVector<RowScratchRegisters> *rows_;
00255   int row_start_;
00256   int row_end_;
00257 
00258   // open_models_ corresponds to rows[start_row_ - 1, end_row_]
00259   //
00260   // open_models_:  Contains models which there was an active (open) paragraph
00261   //                as of the previous line and for which the left and right
00262   //                indents admit the possibility that this text line continues
00263   //                to fit the same model.
00264   // TODO(eger): Think about whether we can get rid of "Open" models and just
00265   //   use the current hypotheses on RowScratchRegisters.
00266   GenericVector<SetOfModels> open_models_;
00267 };

00270 // percentile (0..100) value of the left and right row edges for this run of
00271 // rows.
00272 void RecomputeMarginsAndClearHypotheses(
00273     GenericVector<RowScratchRegisters> *rows, int start, int end,
00274     int percentile);

00277 int InterwordSpace(const GenericVector<RowScratchRegisters> &rows,
00278                    int row_start, int row_end);

00280 // Return whether the first word on the after line can fit in the space at
00281 // the end of the before line (knowing which way the text is aligned and read).
00282 bool FirstWordWouldHaveFit(const RowScratchRegisters &before,
00283                            const RowScratchRegisters &after,
00284                            tesseract::ParagraphJustification justification);

00287 // the end of the before line (not knowing the text alignment).
00288 bool FirstWordWouldHaveFit(const RowScratchRegisters &before,
00289                            const RowScratchRegisters &after);

00292 bool RowsFitModel(const GenericVector<RowScratchRegisters> *rows,
00293                   int start, int end, const ParagraphModel *model);

00296 bool LikelyParagraphStart(const RowScratchRegisters &before,
00297                           const RowScratchRegisters &after,
00298                           tesseract::ParagraphJustification j);

00300 // Given a set of row_owners pointing to PARAs or NULL (no paragraph known),
00301 // normalize each row_owner to point to an actual PARA, and output the
00302 // paragraphs in order onto paragraphs.
00303 void CanonicalizeDetectionResults(
